column3: Sid seems strangely at peace, for a change.

Countess Ystride's missive has arrived at last. You, Sidurgu, and Rielle are to meet with her in the western highlands, that you might conduct your trial by combat far from prying eyes. Before you depart, Sidurgu tells you that Rielle wishes to say a few words.

As Rielle thanks you for the time you shared together, you are struck by how much she has changed. The quiet, unassuming girl you first met has grown tremendously, shaped by her experiences on the road and the knights who have kept her safe. Sidurgu seems to see it as well, regarding her with a newfound respect. With nothing left to discuss, the knight bids you journey to Twinpools together and settle matters once and for all.

Desperate to find absolution in the death of her daughter, Countess Ystride quickly discards all pretense and commands wave after wave of Temple Knights to kill Rielle. Eventually, she attempts to carry out the deed herself, but you and Sidurgu manage to subdue her and kill her remaining knights. The dark knight stands poised to strike her down as well, but relents, reasoning that for all her crimes, she is still Rielle's mother. However, the countess declares that she will never stop hunting the girl, for it is the will of the Fury.\x02\x10\x01\x03\x02\x10\x01\x03Perhaps, in some corner of her heart, she knew it could only end like this. Rielle steps forward and tells Ystride that she will pray for her one last time, that she might find peace in Halone's halls. Grudgingly, Sidurgu readies his sword once more, and Rielle begins to administer the last rites to her mother. As the blade meets her neck, Ystride looks to her daughter, and for a moment, the hatred which consumed her is nowhere to be seen... After a time, Rielle says simply that you will return to Ishgard. Sparing a final glance for her mother, she turns and walks away.

In the end, it would seem that Rielle would rather remain in the company of Sidurgu\xe2\x94\x80provided he continues to be more honest with her. He responds to her ultimatum in typical fashion, prompting you and Rielle to share a laugh. The two intend to remain in Ishgard for a time, as there are doubtless others in need of their help. But for whom will you stand? For your friends? For Eorzea? Or perhaps, for the one within who is ever waiting to take the reins...
Countess Ystride's missive arrived while you were away. We're to meet her in the western highlands\xe2\x94\x80away from prying eyes.
She's gone to great lengths to conceal her husband's deeds, so it comes as no surprise that she'd prefer to settle this in secret.

column5: I...I don't know what's waiting for us out there."

column3: But if aught should happen to me...pray keep Rielle safe.
Right, then. I believe she wanted a word with you before we left.
Rielle wanted to speak with you before we set out for the western highlands.
We wouldn't have made it this far without you, \x02,\r\xff\x07\x02)\x03\xeb\x02\x03\xff\x02 \x02\x03.
I want you to know that I'm truly grateful for the time we shared.
You, Sidurgu, and Fray taught me so much about the world. About what it means to fight for another...and what it means to fight for yourself.
We're going to finish this together. The three of us.
To Twinpools, then. Let's not keep the countess waiting.
Best not neglect your preparations. I doubt the Temple Knights will let us come back for supplies.
I wonder how many men will she bring to kill the \xe2\x80\x9cabomination\xe2\x80\x9d...
Seems we're early. Well, it's not as though I have pressing business elsewhere... Enjoy a moment's respite with me, \x02,\r\xff\x07\x02)\x03\xeb\x02\x03\xff\x02 \x02\x03?
You have his eyes. His nose, his lips...
Every time I look at you, I see more and more of him. And it \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03sickens\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03 me.
You had no right to punish her for what he did!
Who are you to stand in judgment of me!? I have \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03every\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03 right!
I bore that monster into this world, and by the Fury, I shall send it to the seventh hell!
If you're so bloody fond of it, you can follow it there!
It's just us now\xe2\x94\x80no one else. Remember Fray's conjury.
Protect us, and we'll protect you.
Damn you! Get...get out of my way!
Why do you care so much what happens to it!?
...You're not the first person to ask me that.
For everything that you are\xe2\x94\x80that you have done\xe2\x94\x80you are still her mother.
Go. We shall not meet again.
...Oh, but we will. We \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03will\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03, knight! I promise you that!
I will follow you to the ends of the world, if I must. So long as she...so long as \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03it\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03 lives, I must!
Don't you \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03see\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03, you fool!? The Fury wills it! \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03The Fury wills it\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03!
How great your love for Her. Far greater than any you ever bore me.
For a long time, I prayed for forgiveness. I prayed you would take me in your arms and hold me as you did before...
But I know that shall never come to pass.
...I will pray for you, Mother, that you might find peace in Her halls.
O Halone, receive of us this woman, Your humble servant. Raise her up to Your bosom and grant her glory everlasting...
It all seems so simple in retrospect...
The moment I stopped trying to find the answer, there it was.
All that anger, all that rage...born of a fervent desire to protect that which we hold most dear.
...So you are still committed to your path, then.
...And you, if you will have me.
You'll need to talk to me more. And listen...
I can't stand the silence, you know.
There's no shame in sharing the weight, Sid. We can bear it together\xe2\x94\x80for ourselves, and for others.
The two of us will manage on our own, \x02,\r\xff\x07\x02)\x03\xeb\x02\x03\xff\x02 \x02\x03.
There may be others who know of Rielle's heritage...but if they come, we will be ready.
Granted, we could simply leave Ishgard, but that would leave the people at the mercy of the powers that be. I cannot do that now...and neither can Rielle, I think.
We all need a cause, \x02,\r\xff\x07\x02)\x03\xeb\x02\x03\xff\x02 \x02\x03. So what will yours be? For whom will you stand?
...It stirs within you, yearning to be free.

Look within your heart and decide what sort of \x02\x08\x0f\xe9\x05\xff\x06woman\xff\x04man\x03 you would be. But mark me well, \x02,\r\xff\x07\x02)\x03\xeb\x02\x03\xff\x02 \x02\x03. Without a flame, the abyss will take you.
To walk the path is to suffer. To sacrifice. Justice demands no less.
But we must never lose sight of why we chose to walk it.
...Gods help me, those moogles were onto something, weren't they?
Go forth, brave knights of Ishgard! The Fury watch over and protect thee!
So much for a fair fight...
Be without fear in the face of the heretics! Forward, I say! Forward!
Just how many did she bring!?
Stand your ground! Let them come to us!
Forward! Bring me her head! The Fury wills it!
I told you never to call me that!
You were given a chance! You could've stayed in your cell!
Monster! Abomination! Death will be a mercy!
Kill them! Kill them all! All of you, attack!
O Halone, see us to victory! Grant me the strength to strike down this foul creature!
Pray forgive me my sins...for laying down with Your enemies...
Help me...to cleanse my soul of this taint...
Render unto it Your judgment! Unmake this monstrosity!
